page.title: 18A GOOD PLACE TO LIVE?
page.content:
There are many young married couples with children in Thorpe Willoughby. The next most important age group is the over 75's. Both groups felt that Thorpe Willoughby lacked many {facilities and amenities. }Amongst the younger people it was felt that there weren't enough sporting facilities - nor, indeed, enough public transport should they want to go elsewhere. Many of the older residents said they would like to have, for example, a bowling green: younger people wanted, for example, a swimming pool.
There are a few general shops in the village but many residents thought that a chemist's shops would be useful. Bus services run hourly - residents thought that there would be a demand for one that ran every half hour.
